definitions.definition: Ready-to-eat food obtainable from a streetside vendor, often from a makeshift or portable stall.
The representation of abstract principles by characters or figures.
A picture, book, or other form of communication using such representation.
A symbolic representation which can be interpreted to reveal a hidden meaning, usually a moral or political one.
A category that retains some of the structure of the category of binary relations between sets, representing a high-level generalisation of that category.
Having excessive pride in oneself, often with contempt or disrespect for others.
An anger aroused by something perceived as an indignity, notably an offense or injustice.
A self-righteous anger or disgust.
A question-and-answer session with members of television, print and other media.

(public policy) A system of economic exchange in which participants interact in a direct and cooperative manner, often with the aid of social media, to produce, market, and consume goods, services, and resources.
Wednesday.
Pertaining to the voluntary or reflexive control of muscles by nerves.
definitions.example: Multiple sclerosis is a neuromuscular disease.

definitions.definition: Having or producing a pleasing tune; melodic or melodious
Something having a minor flaw
(grammar) a tense of verbs used in describing a past action that is incomplete or continuous
To make imperfect
Not perfect
Unisexual: having either male (with stamens) or female (with pistil) flowers, but not with both.
Known or expected to be polyphyletic, as of a form taxon.
Lacking some elementary organ that is essential to successful or normal activity.
(grammar) belonging to a tense of verbs used in describing a past action that is incomplete or continuous
Bread made from white flour.
A white person, a person of European descent, a Caucasian; a person who 'acts white'.
Bland, boring; flavorless; conventional, bourgeois.
Of or relating to white people, Caucasian.
A dynamic mark directing that a passage is to be played gradually more softly
A passage having this mark
(metaphoric) The gradual dying away of something.
Describing a passage having this mark
Played in this style
To dull the senses or capacity to think thereby reducing responsiveness; to dazzle or stun.

A paved area at the side of a highway designated for drivers to stop in, for emergency parking, or where vehicles can wait, with larger lay-bys possibly having facilities like food vendors or public telephones.
A railroad siding; a second, short railroad track just to the side of a railroad track, connected with the main track by a switch and used for unloading, bypassing, etc.
A widened section of a narrow river or canal, formed to one side so as to leave the channel free, for mooring of vessels, where vessels can lay over or allow others to pass.
A method of retail purchase in which the selected goods are set aside and the customer pays for them in instalments, receiving them when fully paid; layaway.
An extended piece of music of sophisticated structure, usually for orchestra.
An instrumental introduction or termination to a vocal composition.
Harmony in music or colour, or a harmonious combination of elements.
A symphony orchestra.
As part of a set or series.
(of a bathroom etc) Connected to a bedroom.
To remove foreign and harmful substances from something.
To be available or unused.
definitions.example: There's some bacon going spare if anyone wants some more.

definitions.definition: To become very angry; to become frustrated or distraught: see spare.
definitions.example: The poor girl is going spare, stuck in the house all day with the kids like that.

definitions.definition: To be unemployed.

Any one of numerous edible, marine, spiny-finned fishes of the family Labridae, of which several species are found in the Mediterranean and on the Atlantic coast of Europe. Many of the species are brightly colored.
A senior secretary or official with administrative or legal duties, sometimes in charge of some area of government such as finance or justice.
definitions.example: Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster  Lord Chancellor

definitions.definition: The head of the government in some German-speaking countries.
definitions.example: the Austrian Chancellor

definitions.definition: A senior record keeper of a cathedral; a senior legal officer for a bishop or diocese in charge of hearing cases involving ecclesiastical law.
The head of a university, sometimes purely ceremonial.
Short for Chancellor of the Exchequer.
The foreman of a jury.
The chief judge of a court of chancery (that is, one exercising equity jurisdiction).
A small car, the Volkswagen Beetle (original version made 1938–2003, similar models made 1997–2010 and since 2011)
Any of numerous species of insect in the order Coleoptera characterized by a pair of hard, shell-like front wings which cover and protect a pair of rear wings when at rest.
A game of chance in which players attempt to complete a drawing of a beetle, different dice rolls allowing them to add the various body parts.
To move away quickly, to scurry away.
definitions.example: He beetled off on his vacation.

definitions.definition: To loom over; to extend or jut.
definitions.example: The heavy chimney beetled over the thatched roof.

definitions.definition: Protruding, jutting, overhanging. (As in beetle brows.)
A type of mallet with a large wooden head, used to drive wedges, beat pavements, etc.
A machine in which fabrics are subjected to a hammering process while passing over rollers, as in cotton mills; a beetling machine.
To beat with a heavy mallet.
To finish by subjecting to a hammering process in a beetle or beetling machine.
definitions.example: to beetle cotton goods

definitions.definition: Existence without end, infinite time.
Existence outside of time.
A period of time which extends infinitely far into the future.
(metaphysical) The remainder of time that elapses after death.
A comparatively long time.
definitions.example: It's been an eternity since we last saw each other.

definitions.definition: A game, based on football (soccer), in which opposing players are represented by small figures mounted on rotating bars.
The act of kneading something.
To work and press into a mass, usually with the hands; especially, to work, as by repeated pressure with the knuckles, into a well mixed mass, the materials of bread, cake, etc.
To treat or form as if by kneading; to beat.
(of cats) To make an alternating pressing motion with the two front paws.
To mix thoroughly; form into a homogeneous compound.
A metallic alloy of copper and zinc used in many industrial and plumbing applications.
A class of wind instruments, usually made of metal (such as brass), that use vibrations of the player's lips to produce sound; the section of an orchestra that features such instruments
Spent shell casings (usually made of brass); the part of the cartridge left over after bullets have been fired.
The colour of brass.
(used as a singular or plural noun, metonym) High-ranking officers.

definitions.definition: A brave or foolhardy attitude; impudence.
definitions.example: You've got a lot of brass telling me to do that!

definitions.definition: Money.
Inferior composition.
To coat with brass.
Made of brass, of or pertaining to brass.
Of the colour of brass.
Impertinent, bold: brazen.
Bad, annoying; as wordplay applied especially to brass instruments.
Of inferior composition.
Brass in pocket; money.
A brass nail; a prostitute.
Brass monkey; cold.
Land on which livestock are fattened for market.
To give utterance or expression to; to utter; to publish; to announce
definitions.example: He voiced the sentiments of the nation.

definitions.definition: To utter audibly, with tone and not just breath.
To fit for producing the proper sounds; to regulate the tone of
definitions.example: voice the pipes of an organ

definitions.definition: To vote; to elect; to appoint
To clamor; to cry out
(IRC) To assign the voice flag to a user on IRC, permitting them to send messages to the channel.
To act as a voice actor to portray a character.
Sounded with vibration of the vocal cords. For example, the phone [z] is voiced, while [s] is unvoiced.
(in combination) Having a specified kind of voice.
definitions.example: a shrill-voiced little boy

definitions.definition: (of a signal) That contains voice.
A geometric figure composed of three planes meeting at a single vertex.
A rank in the classification of organisms, below species.
A taxon at that rank, often indicated with trinomial nomenclature (such as Felis silvestris silvestris in zoology and Pinus nigra subsp. salzmannii in botany).
A subdivision of a species in other scientific disciplines.
The ability, when walking aboard a ship, to anticipate the motion of the deck so as to walk steadily without losing balance.
The ability to travel by ship without becoming seasick.
The charge for posting an item.
The postage stamp, or similar token, affixed to an item of post as evidence of payment.
The condition of being positive (in all senses); positivism. Optimism.
The result of being positive.
(physics and chemistry) The characteristic of possessing a positive electric charge
Foolish talk or writing; nonsense.
A mixture of solid and liquid food scraps fed to pigs; swill.
Extremely or shockingly ugly.

definitions.definition: Having a very unpleasant or frightening sound
Hateful; shocking.
Morally offensive; shocking; detestable.
A promissory note issued by a bank, payable at a given time to a specific beneficiary.
A piece of paper currency.
A mixture of freshly cut fruit, sometimes with the addition of alcohol or yogurt, often served as a dessert.
A canned mixture of chopped fruit in a syrup.
Awards worn on a military uniform.
Excited or agitated; heated up.
definitions.example: He was het up about his chest pains.

definitions.definition: An institution which provides secondary education, typically in grades 10, 11, and 12, and often also in grade 9.
Episcopalian
Episcopal, pertaining to a bishop of any church
definitions.example: A bishop is entitled to certain episcopalian privileges.

definitions.definition: Episcopalian
A complete assembly, consisting of an artillery tube and a breech mechanism, firing mechanism or base cap, which is a component of a gun, howitzer or mortar. It may include muzzle appendages.
Any similar device for shooting material out of a tube.
A bone of a horse's leg, between the fetlock joint and the knee or hock.
A cannon bit.
A large muzzle-loading artillery piece.
A carom.
definitions.example: In English billiards, a cannon is when one's cue ball strikes the other player's cue ball and the red ball on the same shot; and it is worth two points.

definitions.definition: The arm of a player that can throw well.
definitions.example: He's got a cannon out in right.

definitions.definition: A hollow cylindrical piece carried by a revolving shaft, on which it may, however, revolve independently.
(Chinese chess) A piece which moves horizontally and vertically like a rook but captures another piece by jumping over a different piece in the line of attack.
To bombard with cannons.
To play the carom billiard shot. To strike two balls with the cue ball
definitions.example: The white cannoned off the red onto the pink.

definitions.definition: To fire something, especially spherical, rapidly.
To collide or strike violently, especially so as to glance off or rebound.
A generally accepted principle; a rule.
definitions.example: The trial must proceed according to the canons of law.

definitions.definition: A group of literary works that are generally accepted as representing a field.
The works of a writer that have been accepted as authentic.
definitions.example: the entire Shakespeare canon

definitions.definition: A eucharistic prayer, particularly the Roman Canon.
A religious law or body of law decreed by the church.
definitions.example: We must proceed according to canon law.

definitions.definition: A catalogue of saints acknowledged and canonized in the Roman Catholic Church.
In monasteries, a book containing the rules of a religious order.
A member of a cathedral chapter; one who possesses a prebend in a cathedral or collegiate church.
A piece of music in which the same melody is played by different voices, but beginning at different times; a round.
definitions.example: Pachelbel’s Canon has become very popular.

definitions.definition: (Roman law) A rent or stipend payable at some regular time, generally annual, e.g., canon frumentarius
Those sources, especially including literary works, which are considered part of the main continuity regarding a given fictional universe.
definitions.example: A spin-off book series revealed the aliens to be originally from Earth, but it's not canon.

definitions.definition: A rolled and filleted loin of meat; also called cannon.
definitions.example: a canon of beef or lamb

definitions.definition: A large size of type formerly used for printing the church canons, standardized as 48-point.
The part of a bell by which it is suspended; the ear or shank of a bell.
A carom.
A clergy member serving a cathedral or collegiate church.
A canon regular, a member of any of several Roman Catholic religious orders.
A Near Eastern and Caucasian musical instrument related to the zither, dulcimer, or harp having either 26 strings and a single bridge, or twice that number and two bridges.
A room that contains typically washing machine, tumble dryer, and other appliances which, in houses without such a room, would be in the kitchen or laundry.
A style of boot with a severely pointed toe, fashionable in the 1950s.
Either of a pair of chromosomes (in most animals and plants) whose combination determines the sexual characteristics of an individual.
Stepmother.
To get involved or involve oneself, causing disturbance.
definitions.example: I always try not to interfere with other people’s personal affairs.

definitions.definition: (of waves) To be correlated with each other when overlapped or superposed.
definitions.example: Correlated waves interfere to produce interesting patterns, while uncorrelated waves overlap without interfering.

definitions.definition: (mostly of horses) To strike one foot against the opposite foot or ankle in using the legs.
(followed by "with") To sexually molest, especially of a child.

definitions.definition: Interference
Young or seeming young.

definitions.definition: Characteristic of young people.

definitions.definition: An enclosed vehicle which is used for moving furniture and other belongings when moving house.
To insert something between other things.
To say as an interruption or aside.
To interpose oneself; to intervene.
A style of wrestling with few rules or restrictions
One of several salt-tolerant plants, some edible
The act of overdrawing a bank account.
The amount overdrawn.

definitions.definition: The maximum amount that may be overdrawn.
definitions.example: The bank have given me an overdraft of $2000.

definitions.definition: The extraction of groundwater from an aquifer beyond the safe yield or equilibrium yield.
A series of flues in a furnace; the current of air forced through them.
To extract groundwater from (an aquifer) beyond the safe yield or equilibrium yield.
A person who can bat either as a right-hander or a left-hander.
A batsman who performs switch-hits.
(sexuality) A person who engages in sex with persons both male and female.
The state or quality of being black.
definitions.example: The blackness of outer space comes from the lack of anything to reflect light rather than the absence of light.

definitions.definition: The state of being of African descent.
(futsal) An area of a pitch or field, inside which a penalty is given to the offensive team if a foul is made by the defensive team.
Maintaining a relatively constant and warm body temperature, regardless of the ambient temperature
Passionate
A person or company that makes wine
The buying of commodities or other assets earlier than normal, or in quantities greater than normal, because of rumours of coming shortages or price rises.
To draw or let out wholly; to drain off completely
definitions.example: Moisture of the earth is exhausted by evaporation.

definitions.definition: To empty by drawing or letting out the contents
definitions.example: to exhaust a treasury

definitions.definition: To drain; to use up or expend wholly, or until the supply comes to an end
definitions.example: I exhausted my strength walking up the hill.

definitions.definition: To tire out; to wear out; to cause to be without any energy
definitions.example: The marathon exhausted me.

definitions.definition: To bring out or develop completely
To discuss thoroughly or completely
definitions.example: That subject has already been fully exhausted.

definitions.definition: To subject to the action of various solvents in order to remove all soluble substances or extractives
definitions.example: to exhaust a drug successively with water, alcohol, and ether

definitions.definition: Very tiring.
definitions.example: This task is exhausting!

definitions.definition: A cisgender person.
Having a gender identity which matches the sex one was assigned at birth; or, pertaining to such people.
Bishops seen as a group.
definitions.example: The American Roman Catholic episcopate regularly meets together.

definitions.definition: The tenure in office of a bishop.
definitions.example: Bishop Smith's episcopate ran for more than 30 years.

definitions.definition: A bishop's jurisdiction, the extent of his diocese.
To act as a bishop.
Either of two plants of the Asteraceae family.
A coffee substitute made from the roasted roots of the common chicory, sometimes used as a cheap adulterant in real coffee.
A short piece of text, often numbered, placed at the bottom of a printed page, that adds a comment, citation, reference etc, to a designated part of the main text.
definitions.example: consult the footnotes for more details

definitions.definition: (by extension) An event of lesser importance than some larger event to which it is related.
definitions.example: a mere footnote in history

definitions.definition: A qualification to the import of something.
To add footnotes to a text.
The chores of maintaining a house as a residence, especially cleaning.
Any general tasks that involve preparation.
definitions.example: The computer program does some general housekeeping involving initializing variables and opening files before beginning the main processing.

definitions.definition: Hospitality; a liberal and hospitable table; a supply of provisions.
A small house
An apartment often on two floors
The drawing of air into the lungs, accomplished in mammals by elevation of the chest walls and flattening of the diaphragm, as part of the act of respiration.
A breath, a single inhalation.

A supernatural divine influence on the prophets, apostles, or sacred writers, by which they were qualified to communicate moral or religious truth with authority; a supernatural influence which qualifies people to receive and communicate divine truth; also, the truth communicated.
The act of an elevating or stimulating influence upon the intellect, emotions or creativity.
definitions.example: She was waiting for inspiration to write a book.

definitions.definition: A person, object, or situation which quickens or stimulates an influence upon the intellect, emotions or creativity.
definitions.example: The trip was an inspiration to her for writing a book.

definitions.definition: A new idea, especially one which arises suddenly and is clever or creative.
To stupefy by doping with chemical substances such as alcohol.
To excite to enthusiasm or madness.
(of a substance) Able to intoxicate; an intoxicant.
Very exciting and stimulating, like alcohol or some other stimulant.
A restaurant in which customers select their food at a counter then carry it on a tray to a table to eat
A dining area in an institution where meals may be purchased (as above), provided, or brought in from elsewhere
A lobby, corridor, or waiting room, used in a hotel, theater, etc.
definitions.example: We had a drink in the foyer waiting for the play to start.

definitions.definition: The crucible or basin in a furnace which receives the molten metal.
A hostel offering accommodation and work opportunities to homeless young people.
A hill at the base of a mountain or mountain range.
A genre of painting that rejected the naturalism of impressionism, using colour and form in more expressive manners.
A sound articulated with the uvula.
Of or relating to the uvula.
Of a sound, articulated with the uvula.
A move to another place in the hope of curing an addiction etc.
Of or relating to geography; geographic.
One of an order of priests among certain groups of Celts before the adoption of Abrahamic religions.
To confirm or support something with additional evidence; to attest or vouch for.
To make strong; to strengthen.
An inexpensive waterproof covering used especially for floors, made from solidified linseed oil over a burlap or canvas backing, or from its modern replacement, polyvinyl chloride.
Having practical rather than theoretical knowledge, such as what is learned on the streets rather than in the classroom.
A poison carried by an animal, usually injected into an enemy or prey by biting or stinging.
Feeling or speech marked by spite or malice; vitriol.
To infect with venom; to envenom; to poison.
Poisonous, poisoned; (figuratively) pernicious.
A telephone service (or (by extension) one using email, SMS or the Web) which offers help to those who call, as either a public emergency service or customer service.
A box into which mail is put
A folder or account for the storage of e-mail; an electronic in-box or mailstore.
A particularly strong tidal current
A rip current which may carry a swimmer offshore (the term rip tide used in this sense is a misnomer).
definitions.example: This beach suffers from a riptide that can easily sweep you out to sea.
